channel.title: Bit more help?

item.title: Bit more help?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“hello to you all, post:3, topic:50075”]you mean like…

Procedure Colors;
Begin
ClayColor     := 6005188;
TinColor      := 9013908;
CopperColor   := 0000000;
IronColor     := 3030886;
GoldColor     := 0000000;
MithrilColor  := 0000000;
AddyColor     := 0000000;
RuneColor     := 0000000;
End;

but obviously with all the blank 1s filled in, but im trying to mine iron and as you can see the iron color is in there![/quote]

Yes. What I suggest is basic checks to see if any of the ore colors are on screen and if not, log out, or if there are too many logout. Example below. You could also use arrays, for example have Ores[1] to Ores[3] clay ore ect.

Example:

for I := 0 to 10 do begin if not(FindColorSpiralTolerance(x, y, Ores[i], xs, ys, xe, ye, 35)) then begin Logout; Writeln('No ores found! Changing player'); RandomNextPlayer(false); end else begin e := GetSystemTime; repeat if FindColorSpiralTolerance(x, y, Ores[i], xs, ys, xe, ye, 35) then begin if x = xx and y = yy then Writeln(''); end else count := count + 1; until e - GetSystemTime > 300 + Random(150) - Random(150); end;

I doubt it works but it was a little exaple.

Read full topic

item.title: Bit more help?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

You need to have the rock colors pre-set.

Read full topic

item.title: Bit more help?
item.dc:creator: @hello_to_you_all hello to you all
item.description:
@hello_to_you_all wrote:

procedure SetRockColor;
begin
  Case Rock of
    'Clay'      : RockColor := ClayColor;
    'Tin'       : RockColor := TinColor;
    'Copper'    : RockColor := CopperColor;
    'Iron'      : RockColor := IronColor;
    'Gold'      : RockColor := GoldColor;
    'Mithril'   : RockColor := MithrilColor;
    'AddyColor' : RockColor := AddyColor;
    'RuneColor' : RockColor := RuneColor;
    else
    begin
      WriteLn('Invalid RockType.');
      TerminateScript;
    end;
  end;
end;

ok so above is the procedure that im using in my mining script!!!

but what do i put in the script below, to find the rock color because im kinda finding it a bit weird 

if FindColorSpiralTolerance(x, y, RockColor, 1, 1, 515, 338, 5) then

p.s

the mouse just goes to the top left of the rs screen and stays there!!

Read full topic
